CreateTroubleInfo.document: This API is used to create exception information.
CreateTroubleInfo.name: Creates exception information

DescribeAbnormalEvent.document: This API is used to query exception occurrences under a specified `SDKAppID` and return the exception IDs and possible causes. It queries data in last 15 days, and the query period is up to 1 hour, which can start and end on different days. For more information about exceptions, please see the exception event ID mapping table: https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/37906.
DescribeAbnormalEvent.name: Queries exceptional experience events

DescribeCallDetail.document:
This API is used to query the user list and call quality data of a specified time range in the last 14 days. When `DataType` is not null, data of up to 6 users during a period of up to 1 hour can be queried each time, and the period can start on one day and end on the next. When `DataType` and `UserIds` are null, 6 users are queried by default, and data of up to 100 users can be displayed on each page (`PageSize` set to 100 or lower). This API is used to query call quality and is not recommended for billing.
Note: you are not advised to use the API for the processing of real-time business logic.
DescribeCallDetail.name: Queries user list and call metrics

DescribeDetailEvent.document: This API is used to query a userâ€™s activity details such as room entry/exit and video enablement/disablement during a call. It can query data for the last 14 days.
DescribeDetailEvent.name: Queries detailed events

DescribeHistoryScale.document: This API is used to query the daily numbers of rooms and users under a specified `SDKAppID`. It can query data once per minute for the last 14 days. If a day has not ended, the numbers of rooms and users on the day cannot be queried.
DescribeHistoryScale.name: Queries the number of historical rooms and users

DescribeRealtimeNetwork.document: This API is used to query the network conditions of an `SDKAppID`, including upstream and downstream packet loss, in the last 24 hours on a per-minute basis. The query period must be 1-60 minutes.
DescribeRealtimeNetwork.name: Queries real-time network status

DescribeRealtimeQuality.document: This API is used to query the quality metrics of an `SDKAppID` in the last 24 hours on a per-minute basis, including room entry success rate, instant playback rate of the first frame, and audio/video lag rate. The query period must be 1-60 minutes.
DescribeRealtimeQuality.name: Queries real-time quality data

DescribeRealtimeScale.document: This API is used to query the scale of an `SDKAppID` in the last 24 hours on a per-minute basis. The query period must be 1-60 minutes.
DescribeRealtimeScale.name: Queries real-time scale

DescribeRoomInformation.document:
This API is used to query the room list of an `SDKAppID` in the last 14 days. It returns 10 calls by default and can return up to 100 calls per query.
Note: you are not advised to use the API for the processing of real-time business logic.
DescribeRoomInformation.name: Queries room list

DescribeUserInformation.document:
This API is used to query the user list of a specified time range (up to 4 hours) in the last 14 days. Data of 6 users is displayed on each page by default, and data of up to 100 users can be displayed on each page (`PageSize` set to 100 or lower).
Note: you are not advised to use the API for the processing of real-time business logic.
DescribeUserInformation.name: Queries user list

DismissRoom.document: This API is used to remove all users from a room and dismiss the room. It supports all platforms. For Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS, the TRTC SDK needs to be upgraded to v6.6 or above.
DismissRoom.name: Dismisses a room

DismissRoomByStrRoomId.document: This API is used to remove all users from a room and close the room. It works on all platforms. For Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS, you need to update the TRTC SDK to version 6.6 or above.
DismissRoomByStrRoomId.name: Closes a room (by room ID in string type)

RemoveUser.document: This API is used to remove a user from a room. It is applicable to scenarios where the anchor, room owner, or admin wants to kick out a user. It supports all platforms. For Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS, the TRTC SDK needs to be upgraded to v6.6 or above.
RemoveUser.name: Removes a user

RemoveUserByStrRoomId.document: This API is used to remove a user from a room. It allows the anchor, room owner, or admin to kick out a user, and works on all platforms. For Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS, you need to update the TRTC SDK to version 6.6 or above.
RemoveUserByStrRoomId.name: Removes a user from a room (by room ID in string type)

StartMCUMixTranscode.document:
This API is used to enable On-Cloud MixTranscoding and specify the position of each channel of image in stream mixing.

There may be multiple channels of audio/video streams in a TRTC room. You can call this API to request the Tencent Cloud server to combine multiple channels of video images and audio into one channel and specify the position of each image so as to produce just one channel of audio/video stream for recording and live streaming. The mixing stops automatically after a room is destroyed.

You can use this API to perform the following operations:
- Set image and audio quality parameters of the final live stream, including video resolution, video bitrate, video frame rate, and audio quality.
- Set the layout, i.e., the position of each channel of image. You only need to set it once when enabling On-Cloud MixTranscoding, and the layout engine will automatically arrange images as configured.
- Set the names of recording files for future playback.
- Set the stream ID for CDN live streaming.

Currently, On-Cloud MixTranscoding supports the following layout templates:
- Floating: the entire screen is covered by the video image of the first user who enters the room, and the images of other users are displayed as small images in horizontal rows in the bottom-left corner in room entry sequence. The screen can accommodate up to 4 rows of 4 small images, which float over the big image. Up to 1 big image and 15 small images can be displayed. A user sending audio only will still occupy an image spot.
- Grid: the images of the users split the entire screen evenly. The more the users, the smaller the image dimensions. Up to 16 images can be displayed. A user sending audio only will still occupy an image spot.
- Screen sharing: this is designed for video conferencing and online education. The shared screen (image of the anchor) is always displayed as the big image, which occupies the left half of the screen, and the images of other users occupy the right half in up to 2 columns of up to 8 small images each. Up to 1 big image and 15 small images can be displayed. If the aspect ratio of upstream images do not match that of output images, the big image on the left will be scaled and displayed in whole, while the small images on the right will be cropped.
- Picture-in-picture: this is designed for mixing the dual-channel (small and big) image or big image with the audio of other users. The small images float over the big image. You can specify which users to be displayed as the big/small images as well as the positions of the small images. Up to 2 images are supported.
- Custom: this is designed for cases where you want to specify the image positions of users in the mixed stream or preset image positions. If users are assigned to preset positions, the layout engine will reserve the positions for the users; if not, users will occupy the positions in room entry sequence. Once all preset positions are occupied, TRTC will stop mixing the audio and images of other users. If the placeholding feature is enabled for a custom template (`PlaceHolderMode` in `LayoutParams` set to 1), but a user for whom a place is reserved is not sending video data, the position will show the corresponding placeholder image (`PlaceImageId`).

Note: only applications created on and after January 9, 2020 can call this API directly. Applications created before use the stream mixing service of LVB by default. If you want to switch to MCU On-Cloud MixTranscoding, please [submit a ticket](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/workorder/category).
StartMCUMixTranscode.name: Enables On-Cloud MixTranscoding

StartMCUMixTranscodeByStrRoomId.document:
This API is used to enable On-Cloud MixTranscoding and specify the position of each channel of image in stream mixing.

There may be multiple channels of audio/video streams in a TRTC room. You can call this API to request the Tencent Cloud server to mix multiple channels of video images and audio into one channel and specify the position of each image so as to produce only one channel of audio/video stream for recording and live streaming.

You can use this API to perform the following operations:
- Set image and audio quality parameters of the mixed stream, including video resolution, bitrate, frame rate, and audio quality.
- Set the layout, i.e., the position of each channel of image. You only need to set it once when enabling On-Cloud MixTranscoding, and the layout engine will automatically arrange images as configured.
- Set the names of recording files for future playback.
- Set the stream ID for CDN live streaming.

Currently, On-Cloud MixTranscoding supports the following layout templates:
- Floating: the entire screen is covered by the video image of the first user who enters the room, and the images of other users are displayed as small images in horizontal rows in the bottom-left corner in room entry sequence. The screen can accommodate up to 4 rows of 4 small images, which float over the big image. Up to 1 big image and 15 small images can be displayed. A user sending audio only will still occupy an image spot.
- Grid: the images of all users split the screen evenly. The more the users, the smaller the image dimensions. Up to 16 images can be displayed. A user sending audio only will still occupy an image spot.
- Screen sharing: this template is designed for video conferencing and online classes. The shared screen (or camera image of the anchor) is always displayed as the big image, which occupies the left half of the screen, and the images of other users occupy the right half in up to 2 columns of a maximum of 8 small images each. Up to 1 big image and 15 small images can be displayed. If the aspect ratio of upstream images does not match that of output images, the big image on the left will be scaled and displayed in whole, while the small images on the right will be cropped.
- Picture-in-picture: this template mixes the big and small images or big image of a user with the audio of other users. The small image floats over the big image. You can specify the user whose big and small images are displayed and the position of the small image.
- Custom: you can use custom templates to specify the image positions of users in mixed streams or preset image positions. If users are assigned to preset positions, the layout engine will reserve the positions for the users; if not, users will occupy the positions in room entry sequence. Once all preset positions are occupied, TRTC will stop mixing the audio and images of other users. If the placeholding feature is enabled for a custom template (`PlaceHolderMode` in `LayoutParams` is set to 1), but a user for whom a place is reserved is not sending video data, the position will show the corresponding placeholder image (`PlaceImageId`).

Note: only applications created on and after January 9, 2020 can call this API directly. Those created before use the stream mixing service of CSS by default. If you want to switch to MCU On-Cloud MixTranscoding, please [submit a ticket](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/workorder/category).
StartMCUMixTranscodeByStrRoomId.name: Enables On-Cloud MixTranscoding (by room ID in string type)

StopMCUMixTranscode.document: This API is used to end On-Cloud MixTranscoding.
StopMCUMixTranscode.name: Ends On-Cloud MixTranscoding

StopMCUMixTranscodeByStrRoomId.document: This API is used to stop On-Cloud MixTranscoding.
StopMCUMixTranscodeByStrRoomId.name: Stops On-Cloud MixTranscoding

AbnormalEvent.document: Types of exception events that can cause an exceptional experience

members.document: Exception event ID. For specific values, please see Appendix. Exceptional Experience ID Mapping Table.
members.name: AbnormalEventId

members.document:
Remote user ID. If this parameter is left empty, it indicates that the exception event is not caused by the remote user.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document:
Exception type.
1: exceptional video
2: exceptional audio
3: exceptional video and audio
5: exceptional room entry
4: course switch
6: help seeking
7: problem feedback
8: complaint
members.name: TroubleType

members.document: UNIX timestamp when the exception occurred in seconds.
members.name: TroubleTime

members.document: Exception details
members.name: TroubleMsg

members.document: Query start time

members.document: Query end time
members.name: EndTime

The `roomgString` refers to the room ID, and `createTime` refers to the creation time of a room in the format of UNIX timestamp in seconds, such as 1400353843_218695_1590065777. Its value can be obtained from the `DescribeRoomInformation` API (related document: https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/44050?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: CommId

members.document: Query start time in the format of UNIX timestamp, such as 1588031999s, which is a point in time in the last 14 days.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Query end time in the format of local UNIX timestamp, such as 1588031999s.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: User `SDKAppID`, such as 1400188366.
members.name: SdkAppId

members.document: User array to query, which contains up to 6 users. If it is left empty, 6 users will be returned by default.
members.name: UserIds
DataType

members.document: Page index starting from 0. If either `PageNumber` or `PageSize` is left empty, 6 data entries will be returned by default.
members.name: PageNumber

members.document: Number of entries per page. If either `PageNumber` or `PageSize` is left empty, 6 data entries will be returned by default. When either `DataType` or `UserId` is not null, `PageSize` is up to 6. When `DataType` and `UserId` are null, `PageSize` is up to 100.

members.document: Total number of returned users

EncodeParams.document: Output stream encoding parameters for MCU On-Cloud MixTranscoding

members.document: Output stream audio sample rate for On-Cloud MixTranscoding in Hz. Valid values: 48000, 44100, 32000, 24000, 16000, 12000, 8000.
members.name: AudioSampleRate

members.document: Output stream audio bitrate in Kbps for On-Cloud MixTranscoding. Value range: [8, 500].
members.name: AudioBitrate

members.document: Number of sound channels of output stream for On-Cloud MixTranscoding. Valid values: 1, 2. 1 represents mono-channel, and 2 represents dual-channel.
members.name: AudioChannels

members.document: Output stream width in pixels for On-Cloud MixTranscoding, which is required for audio/video output. Value range: [0, 1920].
members.name: VideoWidth

members.document: Output stream height in pixels for On-Cloud MixTranscoding, which is required for audio/video output. Value range: [0, 1080].
members.name: VideoHeight

members.document: Output stream bitrate in Kbps for On-Cloud MixTranscoding, which is required for audio/video output. Value range: [1, 10000].
members.name: VideoBitrate

members.document: Output stream frame rate for On-Cloud MixTranscoding in FPS. This parameter is required for audio/video outputs. Value range: [1, 60].
members.name: VideoFramerate

members.document: Output stream GOP in seconds for On-Cloud MixTranscoding, which is required for audio/video output. Value range: [1, 5].
members.name: VideoGop

members.document: Output stream background color for On-Cloud MixTranscoding.
members.name: BackgroundColor

members.document: Output stream background image for stream mix. Its value is the ID of image uploaded through the TRTC Console.
members.name: BackgroundImageId

EventList.document: List of SDK or WebRTC events.

members.document: Data content
members.name: Content

members.document: Sender `userId`
members.name: PeerId

EventMessage.document: Event information, including event timestamp and event ID.

members.name: Type

members.document: Event reporting time in the format of UNIX timestamp, such as 1589891188801ms
members.name: Time

members.document: Event ID. Events divide into SDK events and WebRTC events. For more information, please see Appendix - Event ID Mapping Table at https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/44916?from_cn_redirect=1
members.name: EventId

members.document: First event parameter, such as video resolution width
members.name: ParamOne

members.document: Second event parameter, such as video resolution height
members.name: ParamTwo

members.document: On-cloud stream mix layout template ID. 0: floating template (default value); 1: grid template; 2: screen sharing template; 3: picture-in-picture template; 4: custom template.
members.name: Template

members.document: ID of the user in the big image, which takes effect in a screen sharing, floating, or picture-in-picture template.
members.name: MainVideoUserId

members.document: Stream type of the big image, which takes effect in a screen sharing, floating, or picture-in-picture template. 0: camera; 1: screen sharing. If a web user's stream is displayed in the big image on the left, enter 0 for this parameter.
members.name: MainVideoStreamType

members.document: Layout parameter of the small image, which takes effect in a picture-in-picture template.
members.name: SmallVideoLayoutParams

members.document: You can set the layout parameter as 1 or 0 in the screen sharing template. 1: big image on the right and small images on the left, 0: big image on the left and small images on the right. The default value is 0.
members.name: MainVideoRightAlign

members.document: A user list, which takes effect for floating, grid, or screen sharing templates. When the user list has been set, the stream mix output for users in this user list will include both audio and video; the stream mix output for users not in the list will only include audio. Up to 16 users can be set.
members.name: MixVideoUids

members.document: Valid in custom template, used to specify the video image position of a user in mixed streams.
members.name: PresetLayoutConfig

members.document: Valid in custom templates. 1: the placeholding feature is enabled; 0 (default): the feature is disabled. When the feature is enabled, but a user for whom a position is reserved is not sending video data, the position will show the corresponding placeholder image.
members.name: PlaceHolderMode

members.document: Whether an audio-only stream occupies an image spot, which takes effect in a floating, grid, or screen sharing template. Valid values: 0 (default): when a floating or grid template is used, users sending audio only occupy image spots; when a screen sharing template is used, users (except the user whose screen is shared) sending audio only do not occupy image spots; 1: users sending audio only occupy image spots; 2: users sending audio only do not occupy image spots.
members.name: PureAudioHoldPlaceMode

members.document: Custom live stream ID, which must be different from the ID of relayed stream.
members.name: StreamId

members.document: Value range: [0, 1]. If it is 0, live streams are audio and video; if it is 1, live streams are only audio. Default value: 0.
members.name: PureAudioStream

members.document: Custom recording file name. Please enable the recording feature in the TRTC console first. https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/50768?from_cn_redirect=1
members.name: RecordId

members.document: Value range: [0, 1]. If it is 0, the recording template configured in the console will be used; if it is 1, streams are recorded as .mp3 files.
members.name: RecordAudioOnly

PresetLayoutConfig.document: Valid in custom template, used to specify the video image position of a user in mixed streams.

members.document: Used to assign users to preset positions; if not assigned, users will occupy the positions set in `PresetLayoutConfig` in room entry sequence.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Stream type of the user when a specified user is assigned to the image. 0: camera; 1: screen sharing. Set this parameter to 0 when the small image is occupied by a web user.
members.name: StreamType

members.document: Width of the output image in pixels. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: ImageWidth

members.document: Height of the output image in pixels. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: ImageHeight

members.document: X offset of the output image in pixels. The sum of `LocationX` and `ImageWidth` cannot exceed the total width of the mixed stream. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: LocationX

members.document: Y offset of the output image in pixels. The sum of `LocationY` and `ImageHeight` cannot exceed the total height of the mixed stream. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: LocationY

members.document: Z-order of the image in pixels. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: ZOrder

members.document: Render mode of the output image. 0: cropping; 1: scaling; 2: scaling on a black background. If this parameter is not set, 0 is used by default.
members.name: RenderMode

members.document: Media type of the mixed stream of the user occupying the current position. 0 (default): audio and video; 1: audio; 2: video. You are advised to specify a user ID when using this parameter.
members.name: MixInputType

members.document: ID of the placeholder image. If the placeholding feature is enabled, and a user for whom an image position is reserved is not sending video data, the position will show the placeholder image. The ID is generated after the placeholder image is uploaded in the TRTC console. https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/50769?from_cn_redirect=1
members.name: PlaceImageId

members.document: Destination of non-Tencent Cloud CDN relayed push. It is possible to push to only one non-Tencent Cloud CDN address at a time.
members.name: PublishCdnUrls

members.name: Content

members.document: User ID
members.name: UserId

members.document: Peer ID. An empty value indicates that the returned data is upstream.
members.name: PeerId

members.document: Data type
members.name: DataType

members.document: Returned data
members.name: Content

members.document: Data type field
members.name: DataType

members.document: `SDKAppId` of TRTC
members.name: SdkAppId

members.name: IsFinished

members.document: Room creator ID
members.name: UserId

members.document: Start time for each day
members.name: Time

members.document:
Number of users in room. If a user enters the room for multiple times, the user will be counted as one user.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: UserNumber

members.document:
Number of room entries. Every time when a user enters the room, it will be counted as one room entry.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: UserCount

members.document:
Number of rooms under `sdkappid` on a day
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RoomNumbers

SmallVideoLayoutParams.document: Layout parameter of the small image, which takes effect in a picture-in-picture template

members.document: ID of the user in the small image.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Stream type of the small image. 0: camera; 1: screen sharing. If a web user's stream is displayed in the small image, enter 0 for this parameter.
members.name: StreamType

members.document: Output width of the small image in pixels. If this parameter is left empty, 0 will be used by default.
members.name: ImageWidth

members.document: Output height of the small image in pixels. If this parameter is left empty, 0 will be used by default.
members.name: ImageHeight

members.document: Output X-axis offset of the small image in pixels. The sum of `LocationX` and `ImageWidth` cannot exceed the total width of the output mixed stream. If this parameter is left empty, 0 will be used by default.
members.name: LocationX

members.document: Output Y-axis offset of the small image in pixels. The sum of `LocationY` and `ImageHeight` cannot exceed the total height of the output mixed stream. If this parameter is left empty, 0 will be used by default.
members.name: LocationY

TimeValue.document: Returned quality data in the format of time:value

members.document: Time in the format of UNIX timestamp, such as 1590065877s.
members.name: Time

members.document: Parameter value returned in the current time. For example, if `bigvCapFps` is set to 0 when the current time is 1590065877s (UNIX timestamp), the value of this parameter is 0.
members.name: Value

UserInformation.document: User information, including when the user enters/exits a room

members.document: User ID

members.document: The time when the user enters the room
